snippet: A utopian farming commune in Yunnan Province probably would have pleased Chairman Mao, but the Communist Party has never had much tolerance for independent groups, and the community faces a campaign of intimidation.
abstract: Lincang Journal; residents of the utopian commune of Lincang in Yunnan Province, China, have faced a campaign of official intimidation and acts of sabotage, which have driven residents away; although commune embodies ideals of Chairman Mao's communism, unfolding drama highlights perils that Chinese people face in trying to address the country's problems on their own terms.
lead_paragraph: A utopian farming commune in Yunnan Province probably would have pleased Chairman Mao, but the Communist Party has never had much tolerance for independent groups, and the community faces a campaign of intimidation.

headline.print_headline: Communism Is the Goal, but Chinese Officials Are Not Impressed
headline.main: Communism Is the Goal at a Commune, but Chinese Officials Are Not Impressed
